summary: "Saturn Devouring His Son" is a famous painting by Spanish artist Francisco Goya. It shows the Greek god Cronus (known as Saturn to the Romans) eating one of his children. This is based on an ancient myth where Cronus does this to prevent being overthrown. Goya painted it between 1820 and 1823 as part of a group of paintings called the Black Paintings. These were originally on the walls of his house but were later moved to canvas. Today, the painting is in the Museo del Prado in Madrid.
title: Saturn Devouring His Son
